attributes.name: AT

signatures.description: Sets position and size. All parameters are optional and can be omitted (e.g., AT(,,width,height)). Runtime library provides defaults for omitted parameters.

attributes.description: Defines the position and size of the structure or control. The x,y position is relative and dependent upon the statement on which the AT attribute is placed. Values are measured in dialog units for WINDOW/APPLICATION (one-quarter average character width by one-eighth average character height). All parameters are optional.

attributes.name: USE

signatures.description: Variable, field number, and equate label

attributes.description: Specifies a field equate label for the control or structure, or a variable for the control to update. With a variable parameter, supplies the control with a variable to update by operator entry (on window) or provide value to print (on report). All parameters after the first are optional.

attributes.name: COLOR

signatures.description: Specifies display or print colors. Color parameter is required, selectedFore and selectedBack are optional.

attributes.description: Specifies display or print color. The color parameter specifies background color (PROP:Background). The selectedFore and selectedBack parameters specify colors for selected text on controls that can receive focus. The last two parameters are optional and not valid in REPORT.

attributes.name: FONT

signatures.description: Specifies the default display font. All parameters are optional and can be omitted (e.g., FONT(,size) or FONT('Arial',12,,FONT:bold)). Runtime library provides defaults for omitted parameters.

attributes.description: Specifies the default display font. Typeface is font name, size in points, color as RGB LONG value, style for weight/italic/underline/strikeout, and charset for international character sets. All parameters are optional.

attributes.name: HIDE
attributes.description: Specifies the control does not appear when the WINDOW or APPLICATION is first opened. UNHIDE must be used to display it. In a REPORT, the control does not print unless UNHIDE is used.

attributes.name: DISABLE
attributes.description: Specifies the control is dimmed (grayed out) when the window is first opened. The control cannot receive focus and does not respond to user input. ENABLE must be used to activate it.

attributes.name: CENTER
attributes.description: Sets the window to be centered on screen when first opened. The window is positioned at the center of the screen or MDI parent window client area.

attributes.name: MODAL
attributes.description: Sets the window as system modal. A modal window must be closed before the user can interact with any other window in the application or system.

attributes.name: MDI
attributes.description: Sets the window as an MDI (Multiple Document Interface) child window. MDI child windows are contained within the client area of an APPLICATION structure.

attributes.name: SYSTEM
attributes.description: Adds a system menu to the window or application. The system menu appears as an icon in the upper left corner and provides minimize, maximize, restore, and close options.

attributes.name: MAX
attributes.description: Adds a maximize button to the window or application title bar, allowing the user to maximize the window to full screen.

attributes.name: ICON
attributes.description: Sets the icon for the window, application, or button. The filename parameter specifies the .ICO file to use.

attributes.name: STATUS
attributes.description: Adds a status bar to the bottom of the window or application. The height parameter specifies the height in dialog units. The align parameter specifies text alignment.

attributes.name: IMM
attributes.description: Sets immediate event notification for the control. Changes to the control generate an EVENT:Accepted immediately rather than waiting for the user to press Enter or Tab.

attributes.name: READONLY
attributes.description: Sets the control as display-only. The control can receive focus and be tabbed to, but the user cannot edit its contents.

attributes.name: REQ
attributes.description: Sets required entry for the control. The user must enter a value in the control before the window can be closed or focus moved to certain other controls.

attributes.name: AUTO
attributes.description: Sets the USE variable to automatically re-display when changed by program code. Normally, changes to the USE variable are only displayed when the window is opened or the field is updated.

attributes.name: SKIP
attributes.description: Sets the control to be skipped when the user presses Tab. The control cannot receive focus through Tab key navigation, but can still receive focus through mouse clicks or SELECT statement.

attributes.name: GRAY
attributes.description: Sets 3-D look background using the Windows button face color. Provides a raised 3-D appearance for the control or window background.

attributes.name: FROM
attributes.description: Sets the data source for a LIST or COMBO control. The queue parameter specifies the QUEUE structure containing the data to display.

attributes.name: FORMAT
attributes.description: Sets the layout for LIST or COMBO control. The format string specifies column widths, headers, and alignment for multi-column lists.

attributes.name: RANGE
attributes.description: Sets range limits for entry control. Validates that entered values fall within the specified low to high range. Generates EVENT:RangeHigh or EVENT:RangeLow if violated.

attributes.name: VALUE
attributes.description: Sets the value assigned to the USE variable when a RADIO button or CHECK box is selected. Allows multiple radio buttons or check boxes to set different values to the same variable.

attributes.name: HSCROLL
attributes.description: Adds a horizontal scroll bar to the window or control.

attributes.name: VSCROLL
attributes.description: Adds a vertical scroll bar to the window or control.

attributes.name: HVSCROLL
attributes.description: Adds both horizontal and vertical scroll bars to the window or control.

attributes.name: RESIZE
attributes.description: Sets the window border to allow resizing. The user can drag the window edges to change the window size.

attributes.name: DOUBLE
attributes.description: Sets a double-line window border. Cannot be combined with RESIZE.

attributes.name: NOFRAME
attributes.description: Sets the window to have no border frame. The window appears without a title bar or border.

attributes.name: TIP
attributes.description: Sets 'balloon help' text that appears when the mouse hovers over the control. The text parameter specifies the tooltip message.

attributes.name: KEY
attributes.description: Sets the execution keycode for the control. When the specified key is pressed, the control is selected and executes.

attributes.name: DEFAULT
attributes.description: Sets the button as the default button for the window. When the user presses Enter, this button executes unless focus is on another button.

attributes.name: MSG
attributes.description: Sets the message to display in the status bar when the control has focus or menu item is highlighted.

attributes.name: HLP
attributes.description: Sets the on-line help identifier for context-sensitive help. The helpID parameter specifies the help topic to display.

attributes.name: ALRT
attributes.description: Sets window 'hot' keys. Defines keys that generate an alert when pressed in the window.

attributes.name: FILL
attributes.description: Sets the fill color for BOX, ELLIPSE, or REGION controls. The color parameter specifies the interior fill color.

attributes.name: TIMER
attributes.description: Sets periodic event generation. The interval parameter specifies time in hundredths of a second between EVENT:Timer events.

attributes.name: BEVEL
attributes.description: Sets 3-D effect border for the control. The style parameter defines the bevel appearance (raised, inset, etc.).

attributes.name: BOXED
attributes.description: Sets a border around a GROUP of controls. Draws a rectangular border encompassing all controls in the group.

attributes.name: CAP
attributes.description: Sets text entry to all capitals. Automatically converts all entered text to uppercase.

attributes.name: UPR
attributes.description: Sets text entry to all uppercase. Similar to CAP, converts entered text to uppercase.

attributes.name: CENTERED
attributes.description: Centers an image within its control area. The image is displayed centered rather than at top-left.

attributes.name: TILED
attributes.description: Tiles an image to fill the control area. The image is repeated horizontally and vertically.

attributes.name: WALLPAPER
attributes.description: Sets a background image for the window. The filename parameter specifies the image file to use as wallpaper.

attributes.name: CHECK
attributes.description: Creates an on/off menu item with a checkmark. Used in MENUs to show item selection state.

attributes.name: RADIO
attributes.description: Creates a radio button menu item. Only one radio item in a group can be selected at a time.

attributes.name: SEPARATOR
attributes.description: Creates a separator line in a menu. Draws a horizontal line to visually separate menu items.

attributes.name: FLAT
attributes.description: Sets buttons to have a flat appearance. Buttons appear flat until the mouse hovers over them.

attributes.name: MARK
attributes.description: Enables multiple selection mode for LIST controls. Allows the user to select multiple items.

attributes.name: DROP
attributes.description: Sets list box behavior for COMBO or LIST controls. Creates a drop-down list.

attributes.name: COLUMN
attributes.description: Sets list box to use column-based highlighting. The highlight bar extends across all columns.

attributes.name: GRID
attributes.description: Sets grid line display and color for LIST controls. Shows lines between rows and columns.

attributes.name: NOBAR
attributes.description: Removes the highlight bar from LIST controls. Items can be selected but no visual highlight appears.

attributes.name: MASK
attributes.description: Sets pattern editing for data entry. The pattern parameter defines input format mask.

attributes.name: PASSWORD
attributes.description: Hides data entry by displaying asterisks. Used for password entry fields.

attributes.name: SINGLE
attributes.description: Sets TEXT control for single line entry. Limits text entry to one line only.

attributes.name: SCROLL
attributes.description: Enables scrolling for TEXT control. Allows vertical scrolling through text content.

attributes.name: MAXIMIZE
attributes.description: Opens the window in maximized state. Window fills the entire screen or MDI parent area.

attributes.name: ICONIZE
attributes.description: Opens the window as an icon (minimized). Window appears minimized on first open.

attributes.name: FULL
attributes.description: Sets window to full-screen mode. Window occupies the entire display with no borders.

attributes.name: TOOLBOX
attributes.description: Sets window as a toolbox. Creates a floating tool palette window.

attributes.name: DOCK
attributes.description: Enables window docking capability. Window can be docked to edges of parent window.

attributes.name: DOCKED
attributes.description: Opens dockable window in docked state. Window appears docked at open rather than floating.

attributes.name: DIM

signatures.description: Dimensions the variable as an array. Up to 3 dimensions supported.

attributes.description: Declares the variable as an array. The DIM attribute specifies the number of elements in each dimension (up to 3 dimensions). Array elements are accessed using subscripts: variable[index] or variable[row,col].

attributes.name: OVER

signatures.description: Specifies the variable label to overlay in memory

attributes.description: Specifies that this variable occupies the same memory location as another variable. Both variables share the same memory, allowing different interpretations of the same data. Useful for type conversion or viewing data in different formats.

attributes.name: NAME

signatures.description: Specifies the external name for the field

attributes.description: Specifies an alternate 'external' name for the field. Used primarily in FILE declarations to map internal field names to external file field names. The external name is used when reading/writing to the file.

attributes.name: EXTERNAL
attributes.description: Specifies that the variable or procedure is defined in an external library (not in the current program). The variable's memory is allocated externally, not by the Clarion program. Cannot be used within FILE, QUEUE, or GROUP declarations.

attributes.name: DLL

signatures.description: Specifies the DLL containing the external definition

attributes.description: Specifies that the variable or procedure is defined in a Dynamic Link Library (.DLL). Must be used in conjunction with the EXTERNAL attribute. The optional dll_name parameter specifies which DLL contains the definition.

attributes.name: STATIC
attributes.description: Specifies static memory allocation for procedure-local variables. Static variables retain their values between procedure calls (not reinitialized). For QUEUE/GROUP in procedures, allocates fixed memory instead of stack allocation.

attributes.name: THREAD
attributes.description: Declares thread-local storage. Each execution thread gets its own separate copy of the variable. Ensures thread-safe access in multi-threaded applications. Also implicitly adds STATIC attribute for procedure-local data.

attributes.name: AUTO
attributes.description: Specifies that the variable has no initial value and is not initialized. Without AUTO, numeric variables are initialized to zero and strings to blanks. AUTO variables contain whatever value was in memory at allocation time.

attributes.name: PRIVATE
attributes.description: Specifies that the variable, method, or property is not visible outside the module containing the CLASS methods. Only valid within a CLASS declaration. Provides encapsulation and information hiding.

attributes.name: PROTECTED
attributes.description: Specifies that the variable, method, or property is not visible outside the base CLASS and derived CLASS methods. Only valid within a CLASS declaration. Allows inheritance while preventing external access.

attributes.name: TYPE
attributes.description: Declares that this structure can be used as a data type for other variable declarations. Allows GROUP/QUEUE/CLASS to be reused as a template. Variables can then be declared using this type, inheriting all its fields and structure.

attributes.name: PRE

signatures.description: Specifies the prefix for field labels

attributes.description: Declares a field label prefix for the structure. All field labels within the structure are automatically prefixed with this value. Used for namespacing and avoiding label conflicts. Example: PRE(CUS) makes field 'Name' accessible as 'CUS:Name'.

attributes.name: BINDABLE
attributes.description: Allows dynamic expression evaluation on the structure using BIND() and EVALUATE(). Makes field names available at runtime for dynamic queries and calculations. Fields must have NAME attribute for BINDABLE to work.

attributes.name: DRIVER
attributes.description: Specifies the file driver type for the FILE declaration. Common drivers: 'TOPSPEED' (TPS), 'ASCII', 'DOS', 'BASIC', 'CLARION', 'BTRIEVE', 'MSSQL', 'ODBC'. Required attribute for FILE declarations.

attributes.name: CREATE
attributes.description: Specifies that the file should be created if it doesn't exist when opened. Without CREATE, attempting to open a non-existent file will result in an error. Typically used with CREATE mode file operations.

attributes.name: OWNER

signatures.description: Specifies the owner password for encrypted files

attributes.description: Specifies the owner password for encrypted TopSpeed files. Required when using ENCRYPT attribute. The owner has full access including ability to change encryption and structure. Used with TopSpeed driver only.

attributes.name: ENCRYPT
attributes.description: Specifies that the file should be encrypted. Requires OWNER attribute to specify the encryption password. Provides data security by encrypting file contents. Used with TopSpeed driver only.

attributes.name: RECLAIM
attributes.description: Specifies that deleted record space should be reclaimed and reused. Without RECLAIM, deleted records leave gaps in the file. RECLAIM compacts the file by reusing deleted space, reducing file size over time.

attributes.name: IMPLEMENTS
attributes.description: Adds additional methods to a CLASS by implementing an INTERFACE. When a class implements an interface, it inherits all methods defined in the INTERFACE and must provide implementations for them. A class may implement multiple interfaces.

attributes.name: LINK

signatures.description: Names a file to add to the link list

attributes.description: Names a file to add to the link list for the current project when using this CLASS. Typically names a .LIB or .OBJ file to be linked. Normally the same as the MODULE parameter but can explicitly name library or object files.

attributes.name: MODULE

signatures.description: Specifies the source file containing CLASS method implementations

attributes.description: CLASS attribute that specifies the source code file containing the CLASS method implementations. The module file must be included in the project. Used to separate class definition from implementation. Note: MODULE is also a keyword used in MAP blocks to declare procedure prototypes - see builtins.

attributes.name: RAW
attributes.description: PROCEDURE attribute. Specifies that STRING or GROUP parameters pass only the memory address without passing the length. Also alters behavior of ? and *? parameters. Used in MAP or CLASS procedure prototypes for 3GL language compatibility.

attributes.name: PASCAL
attributes.description: PROCEDURE attribute. Specifies PASCAL calling convention (left to right stack-based parameter passing). Windows-standard calling convention for 32-bit applications. Used in MAP or CLASS procedure prototypes for compatibility with third-party libraries and Windows API.

attributes.name: C
attributes.description: PROCEDURE attribute. Specifies C calling convention (right to left stack-based parameter passing). Used in MAP or CLASS procedure prototypes for compatibility with third-party C libraries not compiled with TopSpeed compiler.

attributes.name: PROC
attributes.description: PROCEDURE attribute. Specifies that a PROCEDURE with a return type may be called without using the return value, without generating a compiler warning. Can be used in MAP or CLASS procedure prototypes.

attributes.name: VIRTUAL
attributes.description: CLASS method attribute. Specifies the PROCEDURE is a virtual method of a CLASS structure. Virtual methods can be overridden in derived classes using late binding (polymorphism).

attributes.name: REPLACE
attributes.description: CLASS method attribute. Specifies that the 'Construct' or 'Destruct' PROCEDURE in the derived CLASS completely replaces the constructor or destructor of its parent CLASS (does not call parent constructor/destructor).

attributes.name: DERIVED
attributes.description: CLASS method attribute. Specifies the PROCEDURE is a derived method of a CLASS structure. There must be a matching prototype in the parent class that this method overrides.

attributes.name: ONCE
attributes.description: INCLUDE attribute. Prevents data contained in the INCLUDE file from being compiled more than once. Eliminates duplicate definition compile warnings or errors when the same include file is referenced multiple times.
